Sentencas: The development of a new generation of solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs) operating at lower temperatures with competitive performances requires the use of high-quality thin layers, either as electrolytes, electrodes or interlayers, such as catalysts, diffusion barriers, bond or protective layers.
Titulo: Input of atomic layer deposition for solid oxide fuel cell applications

Sentencas: Atomic layer deposition (ALD) is a sequential chemical vapour deposition (CVD) technique allowing processing of one mono-atomic layer after another, conformal, adherent and homogeneous nano-scaled films which are often crystalline as-deposited without the need of high-temperature annealing treatments.
Titulo: Input of atomic layer deposition for solid oxide fuel cell applications

Sentencas: Moreover, the scalability of ALD offers an important prospect for industrial applications.
Titulo: Input of atomic layer deposition for solid oxide fuel cell applications

Sentencas: In this work, the literature dealing with ALD applied to SOFCs is thoroughly analysed, showing the present achievements as well as the numerous advantages of this technique.
Titulo: Input of atomic layer deposition for solid oxide fuel cell applications

Sentencas: New developments for the future are currently in progress extending the potential use of ALD to other high-temperature devices such as proton electrolyte fuel cells, high-temperature water electrolysis, HTWE (with reversed SOFC-type systems) and molten carbonate fuel cells (MCFCs).
Titulo: Input of atomic layer deposition for solid oxide fuel cell applications
